intro: Cucullaria vochy, commonly known as the velvet tamarisk, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its ornamental value is due to its delicate foliage and unique floral structure.
